channel.title: Does this seem legitimate?
channel.description:
So I'm looking for a new computer, my mom's work told her that she can get any of the items/computers in this list up to 50% off.... http://www.ebay.com/sch/hitech-assets/m.html?_ipg=50&_sop=12&_rdc=1
[Removed a lot of links]

item.title: Does this seem legitimate?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

motherboard: any one that will fit your cpu socket with the features to need, if you want more sata connectors you’ll want a more expensive harddrive and if you don’t want built in (terrible quality) wifi you can get a cheap mobo

same for hdd, buy the biggest cheapest one you can from a good manufacturer and you won’t have a problem, if you want an ssd you’ll have to read reviews first but the same principle applies

Read full topic

item.title: Does this seem legitimate?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Alright well, I’m trying to convince my parents to let me spend some of my saved-up money to buy a computer (I have $1400, could build a decent computer with <$700).

Thinking:
Intel i5 3.0GHz
650ti gfx
4-8gb DDR3
[Please recommend a motherboard & hdd]

Please give me any available advice, would be greatly appreciated

Read full topic

item.title: Does this seem legitimate?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

something to note with the computers you listed specifically is they have “good” processors and not much else, you’ll notice they don’t list any specific graphics cards so you can bet your ass that the graphics will be integrated and/or not usable even on old games that didn’t require much graphics processing to start with

and the issue with server cpus is that they do not make good desktop cpus, even modern games don’t fully utilize 4 cores never mind dual cpu quad core systems with 8 threads each

Read full topic

item.title: Does this seem legitimate?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Yeah why are you buying a server PC? Those things are designed to run without peripherals in a cupboard somewhere not as an everyday machine.

Read full topic

item.title: Does this seem legitimate?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Stu:

First two are legit. They maybe even are a bit over priced. The last one I only have one word for. ROFL. I build my gaming computer for a little bit over that price.

so the first one doesn’t specify a graphics card… The second one says 256mb video, regardless of the card I can assume it’s trash

I figured the third one was way too ridiculous though. I don’t think 16gb ram and 1.5tb hdd is even near reasonable

Edit: actually I’m quite confused. When I researched the system it said it was mainly used for servers, yet also on the same dell webpage it says that it has ‘excellent graphics’.

Read full topic
